results.title: French kiss
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Kathryn F. Galan, Meg Ryan, Eric Fellner, Tim Bevan, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Prufrock Pictures and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: Kevin Kline and Meg Ryan star in this romantic comedy about two people stuck in Paris, France. The most romantic city in the world. A place where anything can happen. And it does!

results.title: French Hortson cinema style 16mm projector
results.brief_description:
French Hortson cinema style 16mm projector. Unusual right-hand commercial projector, as used in European Cinemas. Manufactured in Paris, painted light blue, on cast iron stand. Model A.
1 of 2: Projector
2 of 2: Pedestal

results.title: French from France: to swim like a fish = Nager comme un poisson
results.creator_credit: Michael Style, Donald Carter, Schools Broadcast and Associated Television
results.brief_description: French language training film. Teaches French conversation, at the beach. Two girls sunbathe, swim, meet their friends and play a ball game. Their lively chatter using a wide vocabulary entertains and helps students with pronunciation in a natural way. Script by Jean Pierre Angremy, starring Claude Carroll as Marianne and Francois Apestoguy as Monique and members of the Comedie De L’Quest, Centre Dramatique National.
results.title_for_label: French from France: to swim like a fish = Nager comme un poisson

results.title: French explorations in the new world
results.brief_description: With the voyage of Verrazano, in 1524, began the story of France in the New World. Tracing the pattern of exploration through Verrazano, Cartier, Champlain, Marquette, Joliet and La Salle, the film shows how soldier-explorers and missionaries planted the earliest of French settlements and laid the foundations for French strongholds in the New World.

results.title: French children: a farm family in Brittany
results.brief_description: Depicts a farm family living in Brittany. Emphasises family life, showing the work of each member and revealing customs and traditions. Includes scenes in a village school, an old castle and a neighbouring farm.

results.title: French Cancan
results.brief_description:
Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years of absence is an exuberant and affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Patachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. According to Raymond Durgnat, Renoir’s can-can dancers “unleash the insolence not only of proletarian energy, but of the aggressive female, and storm the 19th century bourgeois male patriarchy… A river of feminine energy flows devastatingly, but not destructively, through society”.

Credits: Producer, Louis Wipf ; director, Jean Renoir ; writer, Jean Renoir ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Georges Van Parys ; art direction, Max Douy ; costumes, Rosine Delamare ; assistant director, Pierre Kast.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul, Maria Felix, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Gianni Esposito.

results.title: French cancan
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Louis Wipf and Franco London Film (Paris)
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years absence is an exuberant, affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Tatachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. Cast includes Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul and Maria Felix. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: French Canadians: the St Lawrence Lowland, Quebec
results.creator_credit: J.H. Lenauer and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Looks at life in the village of St Pierre in Quebec, depicting farming and dairying activities which have undergone little change for over three generations.
